Title: Cost Estimator (Process Engineering)

and detailed CAPEX and OPEX reports for internal and external stakeholders.Provide insights into potential cost reduction opportunities and risks.Benchmarking and Database Management:Develop and maintain benchmarking databases using historical and industry data to enhance estimation accuracy.Ensure data consistency and transparency in cost estimation documentation.Collaboration and Communication:Collaborate closely with project management, engineering, finance, and other stakeholders to validate assumptions and align on cost expectations.Clearly communicate estimate outcomes, risks, and financial insights to project teams and management.Qualifications and Experience:Bachelors Degree in Engineering (Chemical, Engineering) with MBA, or a relevant field.5 to 8 years of cost estimation experience, particularly in FEED stage of process engineering projects.Proven expertise with AACE Class 2 cost estimating standards.Experience in Financial Modeling (FM) and conducting Life Cycle Assessments (LCA).Proficiency in advanced Excel, VBA scripting, and cost estimation software.Skills and Competencies:Excellent analytical, numerical, and financial skills.Strong understanding of process engineering fundamentals.Exceptional proficiency in Excel-based modeling, VBA macros, and automation.Strong communication and presentation skills.Ability to prioritize tasks, meet deadlines, and manage multiple projects simultaneously.Preferred Qualifications:Prior experience in Oil & Gas, Energy, LNG, or related industrial sectors.Familiarity with project control and management tools.Certifications in Cost Estimation or relevant project management credentials.Location & Benefits:Location: The position is based in Bangkok, with potential opportunities for regional travel as required.Competitive Salary: Attractive salary package based on experience and qualifications, along with performance-based incentives.Additional Benefits: Comprehensive health and wellness benefits, professional development opportunities, and a supportive work environment that encourages career growth.Dynamic Work Environment: Be a part of a collaborative, innovative, and forward-thinking team, working on cutting-edge LNG and Green Fuels infrastructure projects.We offer the following to qualified candidates:Friendly international working environment with a wide variety of interesting and challenging tasksCompetitive salary packageCareer opportunity in one of the largest international consulting and engineering companiesPossibility to grow professionally and advance in
